name: Frogsystem 2
tagline: Welcome to the project page of Frogsystem 2. The last release was v2.0.0-alix7 and the current development branch is alix8.
body:
### About the project
The Frogsystem 2 aims to be a full fledged CMS specialized for community fan pages.
It dates back to the early 2000er years when it was written as CMS for the famous [World of Gothic](http://www.worldofgothic.de) community. After a maintainer change in 2007, it was released as open source and leveled up to its second incarnation. Thus, the code base is very old and crappy.
 
### Releases
The latest release is [v2.0.0-alix7](https://github.com/mrgrain/Frogsystem-2/wiki/Release-2.alix7) from **10/02/2015**. Instructions for download and installation are available on the [release page](https://github.com/mrgrain/Frogsystem-2/wiki/Release-2.alix7). Old releases won't be maintained, but for updating and archiving purposes you may access them via the [release history](https://github.com/mrgrain/Frogsystem-2/wiki/Release-History). For more experienced users, we recommend to check out the latest changes from Git.

### Online Demo
There's an online demo of Frogsystem 2 available for evaluation purposes. You can access it [over here](http://demo.frogsystem.de), just log in with credentials "demo/demo". Please be aware of the slightly limited access to certain features for security reasons. Also this demo will be reseted every two hours.

### Wiki & Support
We are maintaining a [GitHub wiki](https://github.com/mrgrain/Frogsystem-2/wiki) for this project. Feel free to contribute. Also the [bug and issue tracking](https://github.com/mrgrain/Frogsystem-2/issues) is located at the GitHub project. If you encounter any problems, please file a [new issue](https://github.com/mrgrain/Frogsystem-2/issues/new). There's currently no support forum or likewise available, but you may contact the developer via twitter ([mrgrain](https://www.twitter.com/mrgrain)).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
